isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CATERPILLAR 3176B AND 3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINES - DIAGNOSTICS AND TROUBLESHOOTING - DETERMINING FAULT CODES

svcprocinfo.para: MPSI (Prolink) or Caterpillar electronic service tools (EST) can be used to identify logged fault codes. Refer to the EST manual for operating instructions.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light can be used to read fault codes by following the procedure in Reading Flash Codes, below.

svcsubproc.title: Reading Flash Codes

item.para: Turn the key to the ON position. The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will turn ON for approximately five seconds, then turn OFF for several more seconds, then begins to FLASH any logged codes.

para.emph: Note: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

item.para: The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.
The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat the process.

Flash code 55 indicates that there are no logged diagnostic codes. For a listing of Caterpillar Flash codes, refer to the Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual. Codes are also listed in the Prolink manual.
Start engine and allow to run at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to OFF position.
Hold Cruise SET/RESUME switch in either position until codes begin to FLASH, then release.

para.emph: Note: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

item.para: The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Serv/Check Engine light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.

The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 4 through 6.

Flash code 55 indicates that there are no logged diagnostic codes. For a listing of Caterpillar Flash codes, refer to the Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual. Codes are also listed in the Prolink manual.

svcsubproc.para: This section includes Troubleshooting Charts for International installed circuits and components that are part of the Caterpillar electronic engine control system.

para.emph: To begin the process, refer to the appropriate Caterpillar Electronic Troubleshooting manual and follow their directions.

svcsubproc.para: If the Caterpillar diagnostics indicate that a International circuit is suspect, use the Troubleshooting Charts included in this section for a step-by-step procedure.
The Prolink EST with the Caterpillar cartridge can be used to read fault codes, customer and engine parameters, and monitor various switches and sensors.
